titleStmt.title: The faithful lovers last farvvell: or, Private newes from Chatham, described in a passionate discourse betwixt a young gentleman whose name was Iohn, and his fair lady Betty, who having been newly contracted, were suddenly seperated before marriage, in regard that he was instantly commanded to take shipping in an expedition against the Dutch. To the tune of, My lodging is on the cold ground, &c.

notesStmt.note: Right half sheet contains "The second Part, to the same Tune."
Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of originals in: British Library; University of Glasgow Library.
